title: Cambodian riel
summary: The riel (/riˈɛl/; Khmer: រៀល, riĕl   [riːəl]; sign: ៛; code: KHR) is the currency of Cambodia. There have been two distinct riel, the first issued between 1953 and May 1975. Between 1975 and 1980 the country had no monetary system. A second currency, also named "riel", has been issued since 20 March 1980.
